documentation.description: Finds all possible and necessary weak preference relations on the set of alternatives. It supports a hierarchical decomposition of the problem

The list of all considered alternatives. The input value should be a valid XMCDA document whose main tag is alternatives. Each alternative may be described using a two attributes: id and name. While the first one denotes a machine readable name, the second represents a human readable name.

input.name: criteria

documentation.description: A list of all considered criteria. The input value should be a valid XMCDA document whose main tag is criteria. It is assumed that the preference direction should be set on max.

input.xmcda: <criteria> <criterion id="%1" name="%1"> <scale> <quantitative> <preferenceDirection>max <!-- only max value allowed --></preferenceDirection> </quantitative> </scale> </criterion> [...] </criteria>

documentation.description: Description of values on criteria for different alternatives. It is required to provide the IDs of both criteria and alternatives described previously. The input value should be provided as a valid XMCDA document whose main tag is performanceTable.

Description of the hierarchical structure of criteria. Each node of this hierarchy, need to have an unique id attribute. The most nested nodes, should contain a set of criteria. The input value should be provided as a valid XMCDA document whose main tag is hierarchy

input.name: preferences

documentation.description: Set of pairwise comparisons of alternatives that constitutes the form of the preference information. For a pair of alternatives three types of comparisons are supported. These are the strict preference, weak preference and indifference. Values linked to pairs, determines an ids of nodes in the hierarchy of criteria tree. If value is not given or if it is equal 0 requirement applies for the whole set of criteria, otherwise the preference relation applies only for a particular node. The input value should be provided as a valid XMCDA document whose main tag is alternativesComparisons. For each type of comparison, a separate alternativesComparisons tag should be used. Within these groups a mentioned types are denoted using a comparisonType tag by respectively strict, weak and indif label. Comparisons should be provided as a pairs of alternatives ids.

input.xmcda: <alternativesComparisons> <comparisonType> %1<!-- type of preference: strong, weak, or indif --> </comparisonType> <pairs> <pair> <initial> <alternativeID>%2</alternativeID> </initial> <terminal> <alternativeID>%3</alternativeID> </terminal> <value> <label>%4</label> </value> </pair> [...] </pairs> </alternativesComparisons>

input.name: intensities-of-preferences

documentation.description: Set of comparisons of intensities of preference relations that constitutes the form of the preference information. For a pair of preference relations three types of comparisons are supported. These are the strict preference, weak preference and indifference. Values linked to pairs, determines an ids of nodes in the hierarchy of criteria tree. If value is not given or if it is equal 0 requirement applies for the whole set of criteria, otherwise the preference relation applies only for a particular node. The input value should be provided as a valid XMCDA document whose main tag is alternativesComparisons. For each type of comparison, a separate alternativesComparisons tag should be used. Within these groups a mentioned types are denoted using a comparisonType tag by respectively strict, weak and indif label. Comparisons should be provided as a pairs of two elementary sets of alternatives ids. The following form is expected:

input.xmcda: <alternativesComparisons> <comparisonType> %1<!-- type of preference: strong, weak, or indif --> </comparisonType> <pairs> <pair> <initial> <alternativesSet> <element> <alternativeID>%2</alternativeID> </element> <element> <alternativeID>%3</alternativeID> </element> </alternativesSet> </initial> <terminal> <alternativesSet> <element> <alternativeID>%4</alternativeID> </element> <element> <alternativeID>%5</alternativeID> </element> </alternativesSet> </terminal> <value> <label>%6</label> </value> </pair> </pairs> </alternativesComparisons>

documentation.description: Set of rank-related requirements that constitutes the form of the preference information. In other words it is a set of ranges of possible positions in the final ranking for a chosen alternatives. The label values linked to the alternatives, determines an ids of nodes in the hierarchy of criteria tree. If value is not given or if it is equal 0 requirement applies for the whole set of criteria, otherwise the preference relation applies only for a particular node. The input value should be provided as a valid XMCDA document whose main tag is alternativesValues. Each requirement should contain both an id of chosen alternative and pair of values that denotes the desired range. These informations should be provided within a separate alternativesValue tag.

A set of values associated with the criteria. This input allows to determine what type of value function should be used for the particular criterion. For each criterion that has an associated greater than one value, a piecewise linear value function is used. In this case, the mentioned value denotes a number of characteristic points of this value function. For criteria that are not listed in this file, or which values are lower than two uses a general value function. The input value should be provided as a valid XMCDA document whose main tag is criteriaValues. Each element should contain both an id of the criterion, and value tag.
Single boolean value. Determines whether to use sctrictly increasing (true) or monotonously increasing (false) value functions

A list of all necessary weak preference relations on the set of alternatives. The returned value is a XMCDA document whose main tag is alternativesComparisons. Each relation is denoted as a pair of alternativesID. Each alternativesComparisons tag describes an another node of hierarchy tree marked in its id attribute

A list of all possible weak preference relations on the set of alternatives. The returned value is a XMCDA document whose main tag is alternativesComparisons. Each relation is denoted as a pair of alternativesID. Each alternativesComparisons tag describes an another node of hierarchy tree marked in its id attribute.
A list of messages generated by the algorithm.
